benchmark_details.name: PROBLEMATHIC
benchmark_details.overview: PROBLEMATHIC is a dataset containing both adversarial and non-adversarial mathematical word problem (MWP) pairs, aimed at studying the susceptibility of large language models (LLMs) to irrelevant numerical information in MWPs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To analyze the performance of large language models on mathematical word problems containing irrelevant information and to improve their robustness through adversarial training.

data.source: Adversarial and non-adversarial mathematical word problems augmented with irrelevant information.
data.annotation: Manually curated and classified based on problem complexity.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated as the percentage of exactly correct answers over total answers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in identifying relevant information and solving problems.
methodology.baseline_results: Exact match accuracy varies among models, with drops of up to 41.53% on adversarial samples.
methodology.validation: Empirical evaluation through multiple model trials and human quality assessments.
